message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.RO, cs.AR, cs.IT. 

The paper discusses the implementation of a server-centric PON-based data center architecture, which involves networking, data center, and communication technologies. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also addresses scalability, energy efficiency, high capacity, low cost, flexibility, and oversubscription issues, which are related to data center design and management, suggesting cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) as another likely category. The paper also mentions the use of Xilinx NetFPGA, which is a platform for research on reconfigurable computing, indicating cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) as a possible category. The paper also discusses the use of WDM nodes, which are related to optical communication, suggesting cs.IT (Information Theory) as another possible category. Finally, the paper mentions the observation of flow continuity through live video streaming, which involves control and optimization of network traffic, indicating cs.RO (Robotics) as a less likely but still possible category.
